Must Do: L’Occitane En Provence Factory Tour 
For any skincare lover, one of my must-do’s if you’re headed to the South of France is to visit the L’Occitane En Provence factory. Located in the Manosque region of Provence the location is home to the skincare brand’s factory, museum ... as well as the brands commitment to the environment and their communities.

Drawing inspiration from Mediterranean cultures, Olivier Baussan started L’Occitane in Provence in 1976 creating high quality skincare products and fragrances that were natural and effective. Also very important to ... level to control all the manufacturing. Touring the factories you understand the level of detail it takes and elevated steps L’Occitane takes to make sure there is no contamination. The 2,500 m2 Research Centre brings together 100 researchers and over 20 ... new products. It generally takes 10-50 trials before the brand finalizes a product.


Immortelle flower

One of the biggest innovations L’Occitane is known for is their work with the Immortelle flower. Noticing that the flower never fades from it’s bright yellow hue the brand quickly dissolved it had something that others do not. Now with 5 international patents pending the L’Occitane Laboratories attest to the innovative nature of its research and the exceptional anti-aging properties of Immortelle. And the results have ... the tour was a room filled with scenting cones you put your nose in to smell the range they offer.


L’Occitane is also known for their hand creams. In fact, they sell 1 Shea Butter cream every 3 seconds! The United Nations Development Programme has actually recognized L’Occitane as an exemplary company for it’s work with and for women of Burkina Faso as they are the biggest purchaser of traditional shea butter for cosmetic use in the region. Traded in the spirit of sustainable joint development L’Occitane has been in partnership with the women of Burkina Faso for the past 30 years. By offering fair price trade this has paved the way for economic emancipation for the woman in the region.


L’Occitane sells one of these ever 3 seconds!


As I mentioned before traceability has been a pillar for the brand and ... and quality with excellent traceability. In addition to Immortalle and Shea Butter, Lavender also lies at the very heart of L’Occitane’s heritage. Since the start of the brand, L’Occitane has been committed to both preserving and underlining the importance of this ingredient and finances lavender research through s specific ... ecological solution to save lavender in the face of challenging climatic changes.

Impressive right? Here are some more fun facts… L’Occitane has:


A presence in over 90 countries
2,715 stores
Over 7,000 employees around the worlds
Listing on the Hong Kong ... The tour is free and offered in three languages, English, French and Chinese. For more information and to book visit: loccitane.com/factory-tour



Also if you’re in the region enjoy the ultimate L’Occitane experience visit the spa and stay at the Couvent des Minimes. Located about 2.5 hours north of the factory this ... you’re looking for the utmost relaxing vacation destination few rival a stay at the Couvent des Minimes Hotel & Spa L’Occitane.

L’occitane Lait Corp Verveine Body Lotion Review Hola IMBBians,
I was on a lookout for a body lotion for summers which can keep my skin hydrated all day long without giving that greasy and non-sticky feeling. I landed up at Loccitane and emptied my pockets buying so much stuff. And what I discovered is fantastic. Let’s go ahead with the review ... just don’t like the flip open cap of the bottle. I always end up hurting my nail.



My Take on L’occitane Lait Corp Verveine Body Lotion:
This body lotion is a necessity for me! Trust me guys! I am badly addicted ... It’s creamy yet very light texture makes you feel amazing about your skin. I simply love this product.
Pros of L’occitane Lait Corp Verveine Body Lotion:
• Feels so fresh and clean.
• Refreshing and revitalizing fragrance.
• Doesn’t feel heavy at all.
• No reapplication needed.
• Skin absorbs it super quick.
• Totally non-oily and non-sticky.
Cons of L’occitane Lait Corp Verveine Body Lotion:
• Just the cap of the bottle is a little annoying. I hurt my nail ... and at times more. I wish it was the normal dispenser or tube packaging.
IMBB Rating:
4.9/5
Would I Repurchase L’occitane Lait Corp Verveine Body Lotion?
Yes, I will repurchase it for sure as it is just perfect for my skin.
Would I Recommend L’occitane Lait Corp Verveine Body Lotion?
I highly recommend this to everyone for the summer season as it keeps you hydrated ... all day long. Plus the smell of clean lemons is just so refreshing and uplifting. I just love this stuff!

L'Occitane Shea Skin Care Collection Review 
I am sure, no in fact certain that I am not the only one with ... giving) and I am in the midst of a skin care nightmare. One range that has been gentle yet effective is L'Occitane Shea Skin Care Collection - hydrating yet kind to the skin, not to mention it covers all bases. Here is what I have been trailing recently...


L'Occitane Shea Ultra Rich Comforting Cream £28/50ml
An ultra thick, almost balm like cream product that contains a whopping 25% natural ... as well as leaving the skin feeling and looking plumper. A must purchase for dry to very dry skin types.

L'Occitane Shea Light Comforting Cream £26/50ml
Essentially the lighter version of the cream above, again this contains natural Shea butter but ... make-up which has worked wonderfully. The gel/crème texture absorbs quickly meaning you can apply other products on top almost immediately. L'Occitane aren't kidding when they say that this range is comforting, it makes light work of soothing dried out and irritated ... normal to combination skin, prone to dehydration this is the Winter skin care product that you have been waiting for.


L'Occitane Shea Cleansing Oil £17/200ml
When my skin is dried out, dehydrated or dull I reach for a cleansing oil not ... are they a quick and easy way to remove the day but the nourish, hydrate and in the case of L'Occitane Shea Cleansing Oil moisturises too. Unsurprisingly this has been formulated with 5% natural Shea butter for a deeply cleansing, non-stripping ... to gentle products and there is no cleanser in my stash that caters to my currently easily irritated skin like L'Occitane Shea Cleansing Oil. Such an underrated cleanser (not to mention well priced) that I would not hesitate to repurchase.

L’Occitane Celebrates World Sight Day (October 9th) With Solidarity Soap #L’Occitane #WorldSightDay #SolidaritySoap #blindness Did you know 80% of blindness is preventable? In honor of World Sight Day (Oct. 9th), L’Occitane introduces their annual solidarity soap. Complete with Braille on the bar, this Apricot-scented $3 soap is a limited edition item whose proceeds benefit NGO’s working to cure preventable blindness. Support World Sight Day with L’OCCITANE. Almost 285 million people throughout the world are blind or partially sighted. Yet 80% of blindness is preventable. As a sensorial brand, L’OCCITANE and its Foundation have chosen to help in the on-going fight against blindness. Every year on World Sight Day (October 9th) , L’OCCITANE releases a new fund raising soap for sale in its stores.On October 8th, 2014, L’OCCITANE will launch its 2014 Shea Solidarity Soap.100% of the profits from the sales will finance NGOs like Sight Savers, Light ... raised to launch projects to helping the blind . Our little hands are always at work but do we forget to pamper them.. well they are not asking for an exclusive spa session on a daily basis but that the usual body lotions won’t suffice so a good hand cream can be a great option to keep them happy and healthy. Hands need special care and intense nourishment which only a hand cream can provide to make them soft and beautiful again. So, Invest in a hand cream with deep moisturizing property with which it nourishes the skin of your hands making it soft and resilient.

It can be really challenging to keep hands soft and nourished in rough drying winters. So here are few pointers you must keep in mind:

Make sure to moisturize hands after you wash them every time as they get depleted of natural oils after hand wash.
Proper moisturization helps to rejuvenate and relax your hands which aids combating the dryness and irritations on skin.

Indulging in hand creams can be a pure pleasure and if you are tired of rough and manly hands. Hand creams are what you need!

The cream might feel slightly heavy for summers but its great for winters. It absorbs with a little massage and doesn’t leave a greasy residue or feel sticky.

Also, the tub packaging wont be liked by everyone.

Vitamin E is a natural antioxidant which your skin against the adverse effects of free radicals. It also reduces skin irritations and hydrates the skin. Natural glycerin and sweet almond oil are natural and light moisturizers that get absorbed by the skin quickly and help retain the moisture.

The formula is light weight and has a beautiful scent of floral fruity notes which will captivate your senses. It is more of a hydrating cream than moisturizing that makes it perfect for summers but would require reapplication for dry skin in winters. Soap & glory products comes in a pretty pink packaging and are not tested on animals so a big yay!

Beauty 38: The 38 Essential Online Beauty Shops Shopping for beauty products online is no easy feat. Depending on how good your monitor is (or in our case, how dirty your computer screen might be) that coral lipstick you ordered might end up looking more orange than planned when it arrives at your door—which is actually the least of the disasters that can befall you when purchasing products you can't test in person. To help navigate the world wide web of beauty, we've listed what we consider to be 38 of the best beauty websites out there. These stores span the best in makeup, haircare, body products, hair tools, fragrance and more. Did we forget your favorite? Leave it in the comments below. 
1. Aesop: There's something undeniably cool about Australian-born brand Aesop. Maybe it's those luxurious little metal tubes full of product, maybe it's that everything smells amazing (plant-derived ingredients are a focus), maybe it's that the stuff actually works.
2. Beauty Bar: This straightforward site stocks everything from makeup to fragrance to men's products to natural lines from about 150 brands, and each order comes with three free samples. In partnership with Allure magazine, the site offers what it's calling a "Sample Society,"  a monthly membership program that delivers luxury, travel-friendly samples along with expert advice.
3. Beauty.com: With thousands of products and an incentive (10% off) to auto-reorder, this beauty domain challenges Sephora in its reach and ease-of-use. Free shipping (over $35), free returns, and loads of free samples sweeten the deal even further.
4. Beautycounter: This Los Angeles upstart was founded on the idea of transparency and vows that its beauty products are safe and free of dangerous chemicals. Right now, the beautifully-packaged offerings are limited mostly to skin care (creams, balms and face oils) and lipsticks, but more are in the works. The site features a "Never List" full of scary-yet-commonly-used compounds that consumers should avoid.
5. Beauty Sage: This beauty site has a three-step vetting process for each and every product sold. Beauty editors choose the products, chemists test the claims, and then "real women" test it and report back. The result is super user-friendly and a great source of trustworthy, organic products and reviews. 

6. Benefit: Benefit's site will not only assist you with buying a slew of new beauty products—it'll also put you in a really good mood. Its cheeky packaging and extensive use of puns puts the fun back in shopping for makeup (or at least distracts you from how much you're spending.)

7. B-Glowing: We love perusing the beauty insiders edits. Somehow it makes the absolutely massive selection of men's, women's, hair care, bath & body and makeup digestible. 

8. Birchbox: While the $10 to $20 a month subscription club has been around for some time, it's still a viable method for sifting through all the stuff that's offered in the beauty world for men and women. The samples sent through mail come with info on each product, how-tos and even exclusives to the service. Head here if you're looking to enter the beauty game or break out of a rut. 

9. Bergdorf Goodman: Bergdorf's extensive list of beauty brands pretty much sums up why it made our list, as do the special offers, and the products that are exclusively theirs.

10. Bliss: If there's one thing that Bliss is awesome at, it's making you feel really, really good about spending a bunch of money on beauty products. The site, just like the brand itself, is extra cheery, and the "Special Offers" tab always has great deals. Become a "Glow-It-All" to receive member's-only offers.

11. Bloomingdale's: The beauty department over at Bloomingdale's carries pretty much any high-end brand you could ever want. Some of our favorites include Chantecaille, La Mer, Sisley-Paris, Dior, and SK-II.  

12. Bobbi Brown Cosmetics: The legendary makeup artist is known for her natural-yet-polished look, and on her webshop, there are products and step-by-step guides for achieving that flawless complexion at home. Brides-to-be shouldn't miss Bobbi's no-nonsense advice for mastering your wedding makeup.

13. Boots.com: This is the online extension of the iconic UK drugstore. The US site is slightly more limited, but it can be one of the only places to find popular-in-Great-Britain goods.

14. Butter London: The British import has a dedicated nail fanatic following, but don't look for it on the shelves of your favorite cheap mani spot. Instead, pick your favorite colors for the season here, and bring 'em with your to your corner salon. 

15. Chanel: Chanel doesn't really need any sort of explanation as to why it made the list, because, well, it's Chanel. If you need one, how about the online exclusives, the expert skincare advice (sunscreen people!), or the in-demand nail polishes. 

16. Clinique: The Clinique website makes shopping online for beauty and skincare products a cinch. All of your purchases are stor

Industry Insiders Share Their Top Grooming Picks 
 
CEW Grooming Awards

                                Industry Insiders Share Their Top Grooming Picks                            
The chief rank of all things grooming has spoken. Recently, the Cosmetic Executive Women organization (CEW) presented their annual Insiders’ Choice Beauty Awards.“The CEW Beauty Awards are different from all other awards in our industry because it is the only award selected by beauty insiders, those who can determine what is really exceptional,” says Carlotta Jacobson, President of CEW. “Every year there are countless innovations and advancements in the industry and we rely on these awards to feature the very best. Our list of winners represents the most groundbreaking products, perfectly curated by CEW experts.”Glenn Dellimore, two-time CEW winner and co-founder of GLAMGLOW, adds, “the CEW Award represents an all-inclusive stance – for men and women of all ages, all skin types, and all cultures. The CEW Awards have truly become the leading 'all inclusive award.'"Among the 8,000 beauty insiders that make up CEW, you’ll find anyone from Estee Lauder’s executive chairman, William Lauder, to Johnson & Johnson’s company group chairman, Pericles Stamatiades, and the results reflect just that. Starting at $3.97 and ranging upwards to $225, this year’s top scent and grooming categories include a selection of drug store steals and top luxury brands.And, without further ado, here are the top men’s cosmetic products as picked by the CEW insiders:AnthonyFinalist In The Men’s Grooming CategoryWake Up Call by Anthony fights inflammation and puffiness. Its ingredients include acqua cacteen and green tea, which help to gently rejuvenate and soothe the skin. And, as an added bonus, Anthony products refrain from testing on animals. $38.00 at Anthony.comDove Men + CareFinalist In The Men’s Grooming CategoryDove Men + Care Aqua Impact Shampoo rings in at only $3.97, the most economic contender on the list of finalists — not a bad price to pay for the industry’s top shampoo. Infused with caffeine and Bali sea salt, this shampoo is the solution for any guy trying to achieve stronger, more resilient hair. $3.97 at Amazon.comJack BlackFinalist In The Men’s Grooming CategoryThe Deep Dive Glycolic Facial Cleanser by Jack Black is a powerful, fragrance-free cleanser that doubles as a purifying facemask for deep down cleaning. It boasts to be cruelty-free and vegan friendly and at $20 a pop, it’s the most economic cleanser on the list. $20.00 at Amazon.com NIVEAFinalist In The Men’s Grooming CategoryNIVEA’s Sensitive Shaving Cream is geared to the guy who's sensitive to the typical alcohol-based shaving cream. With 0% alcohol and added ingredients like soothing chamomile and witch hazel, the cream both softens hair and protects the skin from future irritation. $2.83 at Amazon.comVaseline®Finalist In The Men’s Grooming CategoryAt $5.97 a bottle, Vaseline’s Men Spray Lotion Fast Absorbing is another great contender on the list. Like the title says, it’s fast absorbing, which eliminates the sticky sensation moisturizing lotions often leave behind. The continuous spray nozzle is engineered for quick, all-over coverage, making it a great option for guys who don't want to commit a ton of time to moisturizing.$5.97 at Amazon.comLab Series Skincare for MenWinner Of The Men’s Grooming CategoryLab Series Skincare for Men’s Age Rescue+ Water-charged Gel plus Ginseng takes top spot in the Men’s Grooming Category. When used regularly, its refreshing hydration moisturizes the skin for 48 hours, which is perfect for the guy on the go, and its added ginseng encourages the skin’s natural energy to work harder and recover faster, resulting in an instantly revitalized complexion $50.00 at Labseries.com 
Acqua di ParmaFinalist In The Men’s Scent CategoryAcqua di Parma’s Colonia Leather Eau de Parfum features strong citrus top notes, namely Brazilian orange and lime, and when paired with base notes of leather and guaiac wood it’s easy to see how Acqua di Parma made the list. Its unconventional combination marries freshness and sensuality for a perfectly balanced scent. Starting at $220.00 at Shop.nordstrom.comIssey MiyakeFinalist In The Men’s Scent CategoryJapanese designer Issey Miyake created Nuit d'Issey with the intention to have it compliment his technology-driven clothing collections. This scent represents modern masculinity and strength with its leather, spice, and cedar notes and is described as a crisp and mysterious ode to the woods. $89.00 at Neimanmarcus.comErmenegildo ZegnaFinalist In The Men’s Scent CategoryEssenze Peruvian Ambrette by Ermenegildo Zegna explores the musky-sweet side of cologne. Its name comes from the Peruvian ambrette notes within – which is considered to be one of the most expensive, rare ingredients in cologne and the only truly musky scent that doesn’t actually come from an animal. $195.00 at Bergdorfgoodman.com John VarvatosFinalist In The

L’Occitane Body and Strength 1-Minute Intensive Care Review Hi beauties,
After the review of the newly-launched L’Occitane Body and Strength Shampoo, today I shall be reviewing the conditioner, which comes along with it. The “Body and Strength” ... a similar spray from Kerastase (which I shall be reviewing later); I did not bother to get the spray from L’Occitane. The conditioner is called 1-minute intensive care; and it is a silicone-free one.

Product Description:
Formulated with the synergic efficiency ... make your hair shinier. Dry your hair gently with a towel.
Ingredients:

Price:
INR 1560 for 200 ml.

My Experience with L’Occitane Body and Strength 1-minute Intensive Care:
Packaging: It comes in a green tube, which is squeezable; and has a lid ... the hole to open or close; and the product is then to be squeezed out. As is the policy of L’Occitane, the product is made of products of natural origin and the instructions are written in English as well as in Braille. ... basically does is to detangle the hair so as to lessen the hair fall during subsequent brushing of hair.

Pros of L’Occitane Body and Strength 1-minute Intensive Care:

Nice and safe packaging.
Instructions written in Braille as well as English.
Nice mild ... No slimy feel due to absence of silicones.
Detangles the hair effectively, even if kept for a lesser time.

Cons of L’Occitane Body and Strength 1-minute Intensive Care:

1-minute conditioner is a misnomer.
Limited availability in India.
Will not smoothen your hair if they are too damaged or color treated.

IMBB Rating:
4/5
Would I Recommend L’Occitane Body and Strength 1-minute Intensive Care?
The combination of this shampoo and conditioner has really decreased my hair fall, even in these monsoon months; and would suggest this combination to anyone suffering from more than normal hair fall.

L'Occitane Women's Day 2015 Beauty Balm 
Each year to mark International Women's Day (March 8th), L'Occitane launch a product to pay tribute to the women of Burkina Faso. It was here in the 1980's that Olivier ... which we all know to be an ultra diverse yet gentle moisturising ingredient. Over the last 30 or so years L'Occitane and the women of Burkina Faso have built a close bound with the The L'Occitane Foundation providing finical support as well as aid for vital literacy, education and microcredit programmes.


For 2015 the product you can purchase via L'Occitane to help the cause is the L'Occitane Shea Butter Ultra Soft Balm. A sizeable yet easily transportable tin of apricot scented (it smells incredible) multi-purpose moisturiser that ... It is lightweight, non-glossy and non-greasy - all you want from a balm and more.


With the support of The L'Occitane Foundation 100% of the profits from each sale of balm goes to the NGO's that promote women's entrepreneurship in Africa. ... purchasing a few for the important women in my life to support the cause and I hope others will too.

Beauty Behind The Blog: Justina’s Gems Happy Friday y’all! We are midway through the month of August- holy wow! Can you believe it? For this week’s drop of the Beauty Behind The Blog,I have managed to bring you another one of my favorite bloggers Justina. Justina is the beauty behind the Lifestyle and Beauty Blog Justina’s Gems. She is a full time mommy to a 19 month old baby girl , the co-founder of the Lifestyle Blogging Network, and a solid beauty blogging makeup junkie {of whom I read daily}and did I mention she does all that while being pregnant with her second baby girl? Super woman, right! So without further ado, I bring you this week’s Beauty Behind The Blog: Justina’s Gems…
I’m so excited to be featured today on Jamie’s blog! I really love following her because girl has a great taste in makeup and I love her photography style! She asked me to share with you what’s in my makeup bag today, so I thought I’d share a bunch of products that I use constantly! I’m a pretty low key, non-fancy girl 95% of the time. I stay at home with my daughter (soon to be two daughters!) right now and don’t get too dolled up on a regular basis, although I’m always looking for an excuse to wear red lipstick. I tend to go through lots of products and rotate things in and out of my makeup bag, but these products are ones that stick with me all the time.
I am obsessed with skincare, and am always trying new things in that realm. Ever since having my daughter two years ago, I have been obsessed with Clinique’s Even Better Dark Circle Corrector. It goes on like a serum under your eyes and you apply it day and night with your eye cream. I notice a drastic difference when I do and don’t use it! The bummer is you have to go through at least a tube or two before you see much difference. Totally worth it though! Another skincare staple of mine is Clinique Clarifying Lotion #2. Nothing feels as good as this does on my skin and I’ve been using this for at least 10-15 years. It’s a godsend for me! I don’t have favorites listed for moisturizers, but I am always using an SPF during the day. I always tell my husband he’ll thank me for my beauty hoarding when I’m 60 and look 40!
I am completely addicted to foundation, and am always trying a new one. The only consistency I have with my foundation is I have to use a beauty blender to apply it! I tried MAC Mineralize Skinfinish Natural for the first time about a year ago and completely fell in love. Between that and Lancome’s Dual Finish powder I am set for life. They are the two best powders I have ever found! MAC’s gives my skin a little bit of a glow and Lancome’s is totally matte. While we’re talking about covering things up, Smashbox’s BB Cream for Eyes is a new-ish product in the last year and I keep coming back to it. I have an entire makeup drawer full of concealers, and this is the one I love for my under eye area. You can read my review here.
I don’t do full eye makeup looks every single day, although I wish I had that kind of time! I am a huge fan of taking a cream shadow and applying it the the whole lid, and finishing off with liquid liner. Over the years, I’ve had many cream eyeshadow loves but for the last couple years, Make Up For Ever’s Aqua Cream Shadows have been stealing my heart. I have several shades, but tend to gravitate towards the nude sparkly shades (#13, #16) or the silver shades (#2, #3). My eyebrows have been thinning out majorly so a good eyebrow product is a must. I have many favorites, but ever since the Anastasia Dip Brow Pomade came out, I haven’t used anything else! Liquid liner is my jam, and Lancome’s Artliner for Eyes in Noir has graced my makeup bag since I discovered it five years ago. I’ve tried to replace it with something cheaper many times, but I keep coming back to it. I am blessed with long and thick eyelashes and love to wear a dramatic lash daily. I cycle through mascaras like nobody’s business, but when I want to feel really special, I reach for a Diorshow Mascara. I am a sucker for that big wand and huge lashes!
Lippies are another weakness of mine. Let’s face it- pretty much all beauty products are my weakness! But a good lipstick or gloss can totally make you look polished with very little effort. I have SO many favorites but I’ve found that carrying around both a tinted shade that doesn’t require a mirror, and a bold shade I am loving will make me happy no matter the occasion. I am a HUGE fan of Bite Beauty, and love their BB Lip Creams so that would be my sheer choice lately, and for bold I love Maybelline’s Color Elixirs. I wanted to represent the drug store here, so I threw in a Maybelline lippie that I love, but really, I could probably only own Bite Beauty lippies ever again and that would be just fine with me. I want to go to their Lip Lab someday and create my own color!
For finishing touches, I always use a makeup spray. I keep one in my purse at all times, and lately, it’s Make Up For Ever’s Mist & Fix. I love body butters, and Th

Review: L'Occitane Immortelle Lotion Divine & Extrait Divin  The Immortelle skincare range was inspired by the flower of the same name, known for its ability to never fade even after being picked. L'Occitane uses essential oils derived from Corsican Immortelle flowers for this anti-aging line. A few months ago, I was sent two items ... neck. I find this to be a good serum which works with any skin type. A chaque peau sa dose de karité chez L'Occitane Dans les années 80, Olivier Baussan, le fondateur de L'Occitane, entend pour la première fois parler du karité, un arbre sacré en Afrique dont la récolte est exclusivement une affaire ... sa première commande de beurre de karité.  Trente ans plus tard, le karité est devenu l’un des ingrédients cultes de L’Occitane mais aussi une voie d’émancipation économique pour les femmes burkinabées puisqu’elles sont aujourd'hui plus 15.000 à travailler dans cette filière

L’occitane 5% Shea Butter Extra-Gentle Lotion for Hands and Body Review Hello lovely ladies,
Winter is here and I am enjoying ... season gives us a nice chance to pamper ourselves. Okay, today for this season, I have a lovely product from L’occitane.

I am reviewing the L’occitane 5% Shea Butter Extra-Gentle Lotion for Hands and Body. A body lotion is must for winters and I was pretty ... (though I still own 2 tubs of them). The phrase “extra-gentle” drove me to this product and shea range from L’occitane is as it is very famous. So without even thinking for a second, I had to try this cutie.
Price:
$ 26 for 300 ml

My Experience with L’occitane 5% Shea Butter Extra-Gentle Lotion for Hands and Body:
Packaging:
The lotion comes in a simple transparent square shaped plastic ... and semi-runny in consistency. The texture is quite light-weight and smooth. The fragrance is the signature Shea range smell of L’occitane. The soothing smell, the awesome milky texture and soft touch of this lotion surely get a thumbs up from my ... pretty well over here. However, I am not sure about its performance in extremely chilly or colder climates.
Pros of L’occitane 5% Shea Butter Extra-Gentle Lotion for Hands and Body:
• Pump packaging with lock facility
• Soothing and calming effects on irritated skin
• Milky smooth texture
• Spreads and gets absorbed easily
Cons of L’occitane 5% Shea Butter Extra-Gentle Lotion for Hands and Body:
• Pretty expensive
• Availability may be an issue
• Not suitable for extreme cold climates
IMBB Rating:
4 out of 5
Would I Repurchase/Recommend L’occitane 5% Shea Butter Extra-Gentle Lotion for Hands and Body?
No I may not repurchase this as I cannot stick to the same product for long. But I would recommend this product to all the L’occitane lovers.
Conclusion:
L’occitane 5% Shea Butter Extra-Gentle Lotion for Hands and Body is a wonderfully soothing and calming lotion for dry-sensitive skin. It does provide adequate hydration and nourishment. However, I cannot claim that it is the best among its kind!

DECEMBER - JANUARY Empties I found out that Empties posts are useful for me personally, because I can take notes on which products are working for me and which ones are blah. Especially when you tried a looot of products like me (and like all the beauty bloggers out there who received many products to try out), then sometimes it's hard to remember which one works and which one doesn't. So that's why I found these Empties posts useful for me as a personal reminder (^_^)Anyway, since I've been busy lately so here is a collective empty products that I have finished during December last year and January this year. It's a lot of products but I'm glad that I can finished some of my opened stash these past two months. I still got many open products in my stash and I am trying very hard to finish them all off (;p)I'm proud of myself because I finished lots of real size products this time. I also finished a couple of sample size products because I used them during the weekends when I stayed over at my in laws every week.I also finished lots of older products so that makes me happy because those products been sitting on my vanity for far too long, LOL. I hate wasting and throwing away products so I usually would just try to finish them off.L'Oreal Smooth Intense Anti-Frizz ShampooI've been trying lots of different shampoos and this one almost made the cut. I like the formula and the scent, but my hair seems to turn greasy easily when using this shampoo (*ThumbsDown*).NOTE: Recommended, but not for my hair type. Right now I'm using Watsons Honey Treatment Shampoo.Tresemme Scalp Care Anti-Dandruff ShampooThis one actually made the cut. It makes my hair feels good and I also like the scent.NOTE: I would consider repurchasing but right now I'm using Watsons Honey Treatment Shampoo.Taman Sari Royal Heritage Cocoa Body ScrubA favorite local brand, I really like the Cocoa series. The texture is a lotion-type scrub with tiny particles to buff the skin. I like the scent and the practical way of using it. [REVIEWED HERE]NOTE: To replace this I'm using Ovale Balinese Milk ScrubSkinLife Medicated Acne Care TonerI was using this along with the face wash and I like the result on my skin. [REVIEWED HERE]NOTE: To replace this I'm still using The Skin Food Tea Tree Toner.Marks & Spencer China Blue Moisture Rich Hand WashOne of my favorite hand wash from Marks & Spencer because I love the lovely soft scent and the gorgeous bottle!NOTE: To replace this I'm now using Marks & Spencer Lilly of The Valley Moisture Rich Hand Wash.Bioderma Sensibio Micellar WaterHands down, this is my most favorite micellar water to clean my face and makeup. It's really practical and it gets rid the heavy layers of makeup. [REVIEWED HERE]NOTE: Right now I'm trying out Bioderma Sebium to replace this one.SkinLife Medicated Acne Care Face WashThis is a foaming face wash that I'm using together with the toner above. The bottle is huge and a little goes a long way, so it saves you money on the long run. [REVIEWED HERE]NOTE: As replacement, my current face wash is the Himalaya Herbals Purifying Neem face Wash.Nivea Night Whitening Body SerumMy favorite body lotion to use at night. The formula absorbs really well and the scent is oh-so-calming. [REVIEWED HERE]NOTE: To replace this I'm now trying to empty my Utama Spice Lavender Body Lotion.Dove Whitening Original Deo-StickThis is a spray deodorant and nothing special from this. The alcohol is quite strong so I didn't fancy it.NOTE: As replacement, I'm using the roll-on version of this.Rexona Women Whitening DeodorantThis is a roll-on stick type which is my favorite type of deodorant because it doesn't give me a wet feeling like the usual roll-on type. One of my fave!NOTE: As mentioned above, right now I'm using Dove Whitening Original Roll-On. Candle-Lite Juicy Black CherriesOne of my favorite candle, I finally finish this off (and blew the container too because I wasn't careful handling it ;p). [REVIEWED HERE]NOTE: Will definitely repurchase this one. Oscar Blandi Dry Styling Heat Protect SprayA definite favorite dry shampoo of mine. This acts as dry shampoo and heat protectant spray as well. [REVIEWED HERE]NOTE: Recommended.Made From Earth Peppermint Parsley Soap BarI love natural soaps and this one is definitely one of my favorite. It's natural, and organic, and the scent is very lovely. Perfect to wind down after a hard day. [REVIEWED HERE]NOTE: As replacement, right now I'm using Etude House Sweet Appleade Body Wash in my bathroom.Issey Miyake Pleats Please Perfume (vial) I like this one because it smells really nice, sweet, and girly ^_^NOTE: I usually bring vial size perfume for traveling-use, right now I'm using Crabtree & Evelyn Rosewater perfume vial in my traveling bag.Burts Bees Lip BalmThis is the original one with vitamin E and peppermint. It has a slightly tingly taste because of the peppermint and the formula is really nice too. [REVIEWED HERE]NOTE: To replace this, I'm still using my EOS Pomegrana

July Empties [2014] Happy Sunday everyone!Finally I have gathered some empty products for my post, although some of the items I couldn't keep it because hubby threw it away! Every time, I told him not to throw emtpy products and he forget about it. I actually hide my trash can from him~ most of the time his reaction was pricelss when he saw my hidden trash can!! lol.Anyway, let's begin!!♥Loreal HairCare- I bought this cool New Loreal Hair color in June.I used it twice. Although, i didn't see that much result because my hair is black-deep brown. I love this shade too. It gives my black hair a new shade which is cute as well.It wasn't a permanent color which is why the color lasted for few days for me.I washed my hair frequently that's why it faded away! If you have blonde or light brown hair, you should give this a try. ☺Nivea Face Wash For Men- my brother-in-law used it.Obviously it smell like men's body spray. I guess he likes it.Adovia Salt Scrub- [Review Here] I know, you must be wondering how on earth i finished this whole tub so fast!! Haha! Actually I didn't finish it yet! I mixed it with my Ahava scrub in a big jar! Save some space, you know.Hollywood Beauty Tea-Tree Oil- we bought it from drugstore.It is very strong scented. It's a nice oil. I used it to prevent fungus attack/dandruff relief.It is also great for blemishes as well.Pure MoroccoArganOil Hair Mask- [Review Here] I loved using it. It makes my hair really soft and nourished well.Unfortunately it's a very small jar for me! I think I have finished it after 4 washes!! Dove Deodorant- I actually don't like the pomegranate scent of dove.This deodorant is solid which I really do not prefer to use.Thank Goodness I have finished it!BBW Hand Soap- [Here]Their hand foaming soap is amazing! Everyone will love it I swear!! This is the lemon scent and it is not my favorite though. I love the peach one!!♥Valentia VitaminC Serum- [Review Here] You know how much I love facial serum!! It is kind of sticky which I dislike about this serum.But it works wonderful for my skin. I am not sure if I'll buy this again because I still have tons of serum which I haven't finished yet.TheBodyShop Tea-Tree Toner- We both used it. Hubby bought it for acne.It didn't work for him though! But it worked for me!!I think their tea tree collection kit is for people who have mild acne issue.My husband have terrible acne,but i usually don't get acne like one popped out in a month i guess! I loved using this toner though. It smell nice and it does help to control the oil from your face!! If you have mild acne/blemish problem, go for it.Coola ER Foam Wash- [Review Here] This face wash is great for normal/combination or oily skin. I used it on summer because I have dry skin. It was a nice foaming face wash and the packaging is super cute. I don't think so I would buy it again.Pantene Repair Shampoo- [Review Here]I am not a fan of pantene shampoo but I prefer their conditioner though. It was nice sample to try out.Dr.Brandt Scrub- I was at first excited to see this scrub on my Ipsy bag [Here] But after trying it few times, I don't like it that much.Dove Oxygen Shampoo & Conditioner- Enjoyed using this new collection from Dove.My hair feels smooth and smell nice after using it.BBW Mini Candles- [Review Here] Nice scent from the new collection of their candles.   Dr.Jart+ BB Cream- [Review Here] very greasy for my dry skin. I won't buy it again! Time to toss it. Dual Mascara- I actually bought this for leopard print on the packaging! The formula of the mascara is so bad! The fiber part is okay to use it though! Shisheido Primer- It's a sample.It is quite similar to the BB cream/ foundation for the pigmentation!! Sephora Lipstick- So much glitter on it,although the color is pretty nice (muave) Stilla Luminizer- I have enjoyed using it.Got this from the Birchbox [Here] Sadly I finished the tube.The liquid shimmery highlighter was perfect for my skin tone!! ♥NYX Lipgloss- [Review Here]  It was so moisturizing and so glittery. Fruity Lipstick- I actually don't know the brand.It was my mom's lipstick. Before I moved to USA,I grabbed few makeup from her.I wish I could know the name of the brand. It is such a beautiful lipstick I have ever tried.Smell so refreshing & fruity.Pretty orange to coral shade.Perfect for my skin tone♥ Maybelline Eyestudio Gel Liner- I have enjoyed using this gel eye liner. It was my first drugstore liner.It comes with a brush!Schick Razor- Loved using this razor.Henna Cone- It was expired!! Loved using it. BTW do not use expired henna on your body, otherwise you'll get rashes or allergy attack!! Ped Egg- Hubby bought this for him. It is so sharp and if you are not careful enough, you can cut your feet too!! I do not recommend to use it. Not safe at all. FreemanBeauty Clay Acai Mask- [Review Here] loved using this mask. Nature republic Collagen BB Cream- I loved using this BB Cream. I used it once.It smell nice and works just like foundation.I got the lighter shade

クリアな特大ヴァーベナ!と思ったら、実はこれ本物の氷。見ているだけで冷んやりと、さっぱり。清涼感満点の発表会では、ロクシタンの人気アイテム「ヴァーベナシリーズ」がお目見え。例年登場するオードトワレやシャワージェルに加え、シャーベットのようなひんやり感触のボディクリームなど、今日のような暑い日にはすぐ使いたくなるラインナップです。すべて7月12日限定発売です。(編集K)

年に数回の連休には、肌に何も与えない「肌断食」をしてます .

ぬるま湯だけで洗ってあとは何もしない(笑) 日差しにだけ注意してね初日は乾燥など違和感があるしスッピンで人様の前に出る精神的負担があるけど

最適合夏天的清涼香氛
香氣這種東西也是有分季節的
歐舒丹馬鞭草系列就是典型可以讓人感到清爽降溫的夏季香氛
千萬~不要在熱天噴暖調的香氛, 會整個人很沉重鬱悶的

#馬鞭草淡香水 中性不甜膩的香氣, 混和著檸檬柑橘的清新前味
主香調馬鞭草是法國普羅旺斯最具代表性的植物之一, 普羅旺斯的盛夏空氣中散發著馬鞭草的香氣
在歷史中, 馬鞭草更是被視為有療效的神奇植物
它清新的檸檬香調能提振精神使身心舒暢, 是療癒心靈的香氛
每年夏季都會推出限量商品的馬鞭草系列

2017夏季限量的 #沁夏馬鞭草凍凝霜
輕盈的雪酪質地在夏天使用也不嫌厚重, 抹上肌膚會有清涼的觸感
吸收非常快速, 只留下保水的皮膚而沒有乳霜的黏膩感
也可以放在冰箱中, 在炎熱的夏天塗上冰涼的凍凝霜帶來瞬間涼爽, ... 專為黏熱夏天推出的護手乳
吸收超快速, 完全不殘留任何黏膩感
清爽且有效的潤澤雙手

#沁夏馬鞭草沐浴膠
沐浴膠除了馬鞭草香氛之外還含有薄荷
洗起來有微微涼感(不會太強, 我本身很怕太涼的身體清潔產品)
洗完留下清爽柔嫩卻不乾澀的皮膚

總之這系列中心主旨就是"涼"
為炎熱煩燥的夏天注入清新活力
用起來非常舒爽, 提振身心
香氛還沒換季的捧油, 可以試試這款
而且檸檬馬鞭草香調非常中性
即使是男生身上散發出這樣的味道也十分迷人啊~

更多產品資訊  
限量商品只有夏天買的到, 有興趣的可以趕快靠櫃試試

Que lindo esse lançamento de @loccitane ❤ As embalagens da linha Karité foram todas inspiradas nas vestimentas das mulheres de Burkina Faso na África, que fazem ... do processo de colheita da noz de karité, usada nos produtos da marca há mais de 20 anos. Inclusive, a @loccitane tem uma Fundação que, desde 2006, promove a emancipação financeira e o empoderamento dessas mulheres através de projetos e iniciativas. ... né? Os produtos são edição limitada (tem alguns com fragrância de violeta também, delícia!) e já estão à venda ❤ #loccitanebr #loveloccitane #ad Tagged: @loccitane

Compotas Corporais L’Occitane au Brésil
O que me surpreendeu bastante nesta linha foi a diversidade de texturas e criatividade dos produtos. Tem espuma ... e texturas divertidas para proporcionar uma nova experiência sensorial aos consumidores da marca”, conta Cecile Perrin, Diretora de Marketing de L’Occitane au Brésil.
A identidade visual das Compotas Corporais L’Occitane au Brésil é assinada pela artista catarinense Renata Moura, que se inspirou nas cores e formas de cada uma das ... R$42 | 150 ml
Os produtos da linha estarão disponíveis em todas as lojas físicas e na loja virtual de L’Occitane a partir de 14 de agosto de 2017.

Eu amo a marca e acho os produtos corporais deles incríveis. Sou fã mesmo, e tudo que tive da marca ... mas gostei tanto dele que vim logo contar o que achei pra vocês.

Esse creme já existe na linha da L’Occitane há muito tempo, e essa é uma embalagem especial (edição limitada) de comemoração ao 40o aniversário da marca.
Essa edição ... marca.
Chamada de “ouro das mulheres”, esse ingrediente é produzido graças a uma parceria sustentável de comércio justo que a L’OCCITANE mantém com mais de 17.000 mulheres em Burkina Faso desde a década de 1980.
Para oferecer ainda mais apoio à essas mulheres, a Fundação L’OCCITANE incentiva sua emancipação econômica através de programas de alfabetização e projetos de empreendedorismo feminino.
Legal, né?

【 ロクシタン最高峰のダメージケアで髪に、黄金のティアラ 】

紫外線はお肌だけでなく、髪にもダメージを与えます。
最近何だか髪がパサパサする...。
ソレ、夏に浴びた紫外線の仕業かも?
髪は女の命。
しっかり補修して美髪を取り戻しましょう。

髪のダメージが気になる貴方に、今日はロクシタンの新製品“ファイブハーブス ディープ ダメージケア“をご紹介します。

こちらはプロヴァンスの最高峰オリーブオイルを贅沢に配合したヘアケア。
ご存知ですか?
オリーブオイルってダメージを受けた髪ほど浸透しやすいんですって。
ダメージヘアの方にとってこの特長は心強い!

ハードなダメージを受けた髪に、ロクシタンにしか入手出来ない極上オリーブオイルがしっかり浸透し、髪一本一本が、潤いで満たされます。

洗い流す時から感動的な指通り!
使う度ふれて欲しくなる髪に...。
極上オリーブオイルで、ダメージヘアを卒業し、“黄金のティアラ“輝く美髪を手に入れませんか?

只今お試しセットが発売中。
まずはこちらでこの感動的な指通りをご体感下さいね。

陸・海・空で360°ハワイ島を満喫! 
「ビッグアイランド」と呼ばれ、手つかずの自然や活火山をもつ唯一無二の島、ハワイ島。ハワイアン航空を利用すれば羽田から直行便で行けるようになり、グッと身近になりました。今回は「フォーシーズンズリゾート フアラライ アット ヒストリック カウプレフ」に宿泊し、さまざまなオプショナルツアーを体験。オアフやマウイとは全く違う、ハワイ島だけの特別な楽しみ方を陸・海・空に分けてご紹介します!
南国植物に彩られた
大人のためのリゾートホテル
羽田からの直行便で約8時間。ハワイ島の西側の玄関口、コナ国際空港に到着。そこからはホテルの迎えの車で約10分。あっという間にフォーシーズンズリゾートに着きました。ウェルカム・フラワーレイとドリンクで迎えてくれたスタッフの皆さんのはじける笑顔に旅の疲れも吹き飛びます。


広大な敷地はまさに、“手入れの行き届いたジャングル”。南国の花々が咲き乱れ、散歩するだけでもリラックス度満点。2階建てのバンガロースタイルの部屋が全243室点在しています。大人だけが入れるプール(改装中。2017年11月オープン予定)など7つのプールのほか、レストランやラウンジが計5つ、スパやフィットネスジムに8面のテニスコート、ゴルフ場などが揃い、ホテルから一歩も出なくても充実したホテルライフが楽しめます。

写真は「オーシャンビュールーム」(59m2)。キングサイズのふかふかベッドに大きな壁掛けTV、フルサイズのバスタブなど、部屋から出たくなくなるような快適空間(ちなみに、シャンプーやリンスなどのアメニティグッズは「ロクシタン(L’occitane)」でした)。

バルコニーからのプールや海の景色も最高です。ホテルが素晴らしいので外出したくなくなりますが、今回はハワイ島を陸・海・空で楽しむのがテーマ。レストランで腹ごしらえしてから、早速「陸」からアプローチする、素晴らしいオプショナルツアーをご紹介します。

ビーチサイドのレストラン「’ULU OCEAN GRILL」。サンセットを見ながら、総料理長のトーマス・ベレック氏が手がけるシグネチャーメニューを堪能しました。


ハワイ近海で採れたシュリンプやアヒ(マグロ)、そして地元の契約農家で採れた野菜を使った美しい料理にお酒も進みます。こちらは、寿司カウンターもあり、新鮮な魚介をハワイらしいアレンジで楽しめるのも魅力です。
‘ULU Ocean Grill
営業時間/6:30〜11:00、17:30〜21:00
TEL/1 (808) 325-8000
/

いつまでも見ていたい景色。太平洋に夕陽が沈むと、空には無数の星が瞬き始めます。この星をもっと近くで見るために、明日は午前2時起きでバスツアーに参加します。
「陸」から楽しむ
満天の星とサンライズ

ロクシタンより新フレグランスが登場します!
プロヴァンスの朝の美しい瞬間をイメージしたNEWフレグランス「テール ド ルミエール」は、アカシア、ミツロウ、トンカビーンズをベースに、ヘッドにはピンクペッパーやベルガモット、ハートにはピオニーが。プロヴァンスの壮大な自然や風景が思い浮かんでくるような清らかさは、まとう人の真の美しさをめざめさせるような香りです。
フレグランスをはじめ、シャワージェル(250ml ¥2,900税抜)や、ボディミルク(250ml ¥3,800税抜)、ハンドクリーム(30ml ¥1,400税抜)など、様々な形で香りを楽しめるラインナップになっています。 
さらに、クリスマスコフレにも「テール ド ルミエール」の香りが楽しめるセットが発売予定!こちらは改めてご紹介します♪
